reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Borg for three nights while in Reykjavik for our honeymoon. It was a beautiful hotel, I splurged a little for a nicer room (the prices were very comparable on expedia), and we had a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Very nice

likes.disliked: — phones didn't patch through from the front desk to the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was disappointed that the breakfast was not included, because all the signage up, etc., said that it would be and honestly I really think even the expedia blurb said it would be, but it was not, and it was actually quite expensive (in $$$ conversion), when the charge came out.
reviews.title: Beware of last minute cancellations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a little quickie mart type thing just around the corner (leave the hotel, take a right, take the next right, it's on your left) where we bought breakfast and sandwiches for lunch on a daily basis to make eating more affordable, it was quite nice.
reviews.title: Request a room in the Original or Old Hotel

likes.disliked: — They have annexed an adjacent office building and converted the offices to hotel rooms.

reviews.title: Loved art deco Hotel Borg
reviews.text: Additionally, there was a great cafe if you kept walking past the quickie mart, crossed the wide street with the street lights, about half way up the hill on the right hand side. You can refill coffee all you want there, the waitresses are really sweet even though they don't really know english (I enjoy pointing and smiling in friendly interactions), and their pastries are great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: October in Reykjavik, we didn't find much to do. It was too expensive for us to go out very much, the Golden Circle was less impressive than say Yosemite, but the Blue Lagoon was absolutely fantastic. I wish we'd gone there earlier in our trip instead of on our way to the airport, because it was the highlight and very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Great place -- we thoroughly enjoyed our stay

likes.liked: — Location, room quality, and front-desk service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Borg is extremely well situated right bang in the middle of town so that everything is within easy walking distance - the pubs , clubs , and shopping . Tjorn Lake is only around the corner . The city centre of Reykjavik is surprisingly compact - much more so that the maps would lead you to believe . From the map I thought I'd may have to get a cab to the Ice Bar at Hotel Reykjavik but in reality it was only 5 minutes walk .
reviews.title: Great location but don't expect a Marriott inside

likes.liked: — great city centre location - everything on your doorstep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception area of the hotel is fairly small and in fact its quite easy to walk past the entrance of the hotel despite the building itself dominating one corner of Austurvollur Square . The lady on reception was very efficient and spoke perfect English which was a relief as wtitten Icelandic does not seem to translate well when the speaker is English ( as you will soon find ) and so we were spared the embarassment of trying to mispronounce from a phrase book . Toss it away - you won't need it !
reviews.title: A Fab Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had on the top floor was typically Scandinavian - very functional but neat and tidy . Wooden floors and an art deco feel ( which most of the hotel has ) . Decent sized satellite TV but not too many channels . Comfy bed .
reviews.title: Pefect stay

likes.liked: — The shower, the comfy bed and the location - everything really

reviews.text: The bathroom was OK sized and had one of those strange showers where there is an all-round shower curtain in the middle of a level floor so the marble floor got a right good soaking no matter how careful I was ! Maybe I didn't have the knack !
reviews.title: Unqualified recommendation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room – We stayed in a suite with a king bed for 3 nights – Sun-Wed. The room was very nice and spacious although prone to outside noise. The front of the hotel (where our room 412 was) faces a small but fairly busy square. The rear of the hotel might be quieter. The bed was very comfortable and nice bedding. TV was hi-tech but went on in middle of night as someone had set some sort of watching schedule (this was separate from wake-up time) that was hard to disable – very odd.
reviews.title: Plenty of good stuff, but not ideal

reviews.text: Bathroom – Very nice. Had heated floor, enough counter space, full shower stall and a separate tub with a handheld sprayer. Looked and smelled new.
reviews.title: Nice central location

reviews.text: Location – Excellent apart from noise issues. During the day and evening there is constant but not too loud street noise. On Sun and Tue nights it was quiet. But, on Monday night starting about 11pm young people started to gather at a night club off the square and then the music from the club could be heard starting at midnight. We needed to use earplugs and extra sleep medicine. Had it been our first night we would have asked to be moved to the rear of the hotel but we figured (hoped) it was a special event. And, Tue night was quiet so I guess so. Beware for Fri or Sat though.
reviews.title: Not as nice as expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff/service – very nice. Helpful and courteous. Note that there is no staff to help with luggage – you lug it to/from your room yourself. This was also true at Hotel Odinsve which we stayed at just prior to Hotel Borg.
reviews.title: Outsanding renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast: Very disappointing. Scrambled "eggs" were fake and lacked any flavor. Sausages were bite-size and also not very flavorful. Bacon was good. The only other protein was two deli meats and cheeses (but I’m lactose intolerant so cheese is out). The bakery and fruit choices were OK but even my wife (who eats that sort of breakfast) was disappointed. I don’t know how but even the orange juice had no flavor. We didn’t even bother to eat breakfast our last morning. I don't expect a lot from these buffets but this was poor. Contrast to the nice buffet at Odinsve - see my review for that hotel.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I, along with another couple, stayed 2 nights at the Borg Hotel on a stopover in Iceland, while on our way to Wales. The hotel is elegant and clean, the style is Art Deco, the bathrooms are fabulous. We had a room with a view of the square, which was beautiful. Around midnight we could hear some people partying in the square, but it only added to our "being on vacation" feel to get up and watch the ongoings. The rooms are decked out with Bang & Olufsson TV's and phones, plush duvets, and high end toiletries. The hotel is located within walking distance of everything you came to Reykjavik to see. We loved the front desk staff, especially Kristin the Concierge, who went out of their way to make everything perfect for our group - especially given our friends were getting married during our brief stop there. It is a pricey option, but everything in Iceland is pricey, and I feel we received value for our money.
reviews.title: Worth every penny!

reviews.text: The hotel is ok, as others have said not great for the price. It is in the center of everything - BUT - it is surrounded by bars (that close at 5am) and the pounding bass, loud music and frat house noise is miserable. The construction continues, too, my windows are entirely blocked by scaffolding.
reviews.title: nightmare on the weekend

reviews.text: Stayed two nights in a suite at the Hotel Borg. The room was very nice, although nothing special considering the price. Very expensive, just like everything else in Iceland.
reviews.title: Not quite right......

reviews.text: The rest of the hotel was quite disappointing, with the breakfast room and the breakfast itself being the lowpoints of the stay. Not good.... There was one restaurant that looked good, Silfur, but when asked they were fully booked. I was disappointed that they did not keep a table or two for hotelguests, but no. We asked at 11 a.m. and no luck.
reviews.title: Lovely Art Deco hotel in the hear to Reykjavic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One more thing: If you like to sleep at night, do not get a room towards the square. There was shrieking and partying OUTSIDE all the neighboring discotecs absolutely all night. Very disturbing, and having to walk my seven year old son to the car at 6 a.m. to get to the airport and at the same time trying to ignore approximately 50 drunks over a distance of maybe 100 meters was no fun either.
reviews.title: Superb Location

likes.liked: — The location and great feather duvets
